_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The property located at 1 Industrial Road, Dayton New Jersey is a warehouse and distribution center for Hilti Inc.  Hilti manufactures and sells products to the construction industry.  The following substances have been identified as materials that may be present at the facility above the threshold quantity in consumer commodity sized containers.

00-1-11 Flammable Mixture* (NJDEP TCPA, EPA RMP)
*75-28-5 Isobutane
*74-98-6 Propane

Stationary Source Identification:

Hilti has identified the storage of the referenced materials as the only stationary source in the building.  The products that contain the flammable mixture are stored in a temperature controlled area designated as the "cold room".  There is a subsection of the cold room that is enclosed by chain link fencing that is referred to as the "cage".  All of the aerosol products that contain any of the compounds in the flammable mixture are stored inside the cage.  The cold room is equipped with an exhaust fan that can be used in the event of an emergency.

Emergency Response:

In the event of a discharge, Hilti employees will follow the onsite emergency response protocols.  The emergency response plan will be coordinated with the Middlesex County Office of Emergency Management (OEM).

Five Year Accident History:

The warehouse has been in operation since July 2011 under different management.  There have been no known releases of hazardous materials from the facility.

Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Procedures:

Hilti has developed and implemented Standard Operating Procedures (SOPS) and a Risk Management Plan in accordance with NJAC 7:31 and 40 CFR 68.  In addition, Hilti utilizes frequent visual inspections to determine the presence of a leak.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Hilti has identified the hazards of working with extraordinarily hazardous substances onsite and has developed programs and systems to safeguard against those hazards.  These procedures are subject to

a management of change procedure, which allows the facility management to review and upgrade procedures and programs as necessary.  Hilti will continue to review the procedures and implement protective solutions to health and safety concerns.  There are no additional planned changes to improve safety associated with the handling of extraordinarily hazardous substances at this time.
